title: Closed Polygon Edge Cut detection
description: Adds functionality to detect closed polygons from Edge.Cuts segments in KiCad files and convert them into pcb_cutout elements in the circuit JSON.

title: Add hole offset support for plated holes with rectangular pads
description: Add hole offset support for plated holes with rectangular pads, allowing custom offsets for better alignment in 3D and PCB geometries.
body:
added  **hole offset support** (`hole_offset_x`, `hole_offset_y`) for **plated holes with rectangular pads**, improving alignment and realism in 3D and PCB geometries.

Plated holes with rectangular pads now **respect custom hole offsets**, maintaining proper copper continuity and accurate board subtraction in both **3D renderings** and **manifold processing**.

title: Support pill and rotated_pill hole shape
description: Adds support for pill and rotated pill hole shapes in PCB design, allowing for more versatile hole configurations.

title: fix: relative components are passed as obstacles to calculate-packing
description: Fixes the issue where relative components are not considered as obstacles in the packing calculation, ensuring accurate placement of PCB components.

title: add the PcbNoteText component
description: Adds the PcbNoteText component for rendering text notes on PCB layouts with customizable properties such as font, size, and color.

title: feat: enhance CadModel URL handling and add tests for relative paths
description: Updated CadModel to use constructAssetUrl for better URL management and improved cache-busting logic for model URLs, along with tests for handling relative paths correctly.
body:
- Updated CadModel to use constructAssetUrl for better URL management.
- Improved cache-busting logic for model URLs.
- Added tests to verify CadModel handles relative paths correctly.

title: Respect board thickness for cadmodel offsets
description: Reads the board components parsed thickness when calculating board thickness and updates cadmodel properties to expose zOffsetFromSurface, along with adding a test for cadmodel surface offset.
body:
## Summary
- read the board component's parsed thickness when calculating boardThickness
- update @tscircuit/props to 0.0.363 so cadmodel props expose zOffsetFromSurface
- add a cadmodel surface offset test that sets an explicit board thickness

## Testing
- bun test tests/components/primitive-components/cadmodel-z-offset-from-surface.test.tsx
- bunx tsc --noEmit
- bun run format

------
https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_68eeafa1e468832eaceb15ab2b15da99

title: feat: Comment on PRs with contribution level as tscircuitbot (#227)
description: This implements the requested feature from issue 227 to automatically comment on PRs with their contribution level and a link to the contribution tracker.
body:
/claim #227 
/closes #227 

__Description:__

This implements the requested feature from issue #227 to automatically comment on PRs with their contribution level and a link to the contribution tracker.

## Changes Made

### 1. Added PR Commenting Functionality

- Created `commentOnPR()` function in `lib/notifications/notify-pr-change.ts`

- Posts formatted comments showing:

  - Contribution level with star rating (⭐⭐⭐etc.)
  - Impact level (Major/Minor/Tiny)
  - Link to contribution tracker at [](https://contributions.tscircuit.com)<https://contributions.tscircuit.com>
  - Attribution to tscircuitbot

### 2. Extended GitHub API Integration

- Added `issues.createComment` method to `CachedOctokit` class in `lib/data-retrieval/cachedOctokit.ts`
- Enables commenting on PRs (which are treated as issues in GitHub API)

### 3. Integrated into Notification Workflow

- Updated `scripts/pr-notifications.ts` to call `commentOnPR()` after analyzing each PR
- Runs as part of the existing hourly PR notification process

## Example Comment Format

```javascript
Thank you for your contribution! 🎉

**Contribution Level:** ⭐⭐⭐ (significant)  
**Impact:** Major

Track your contributions and see the leaderboard at: [tscircuit Contribution Tracker](https://contributions.tscircuit.com)

---

*Comment posted by tscircuitbot*
```

title: Include pcb cutout polygons in SVG transform bounds
description: Includes pcb cutout shapes when determining PCB SVG bounds so polygon cutouts contribute to the transform and adds a regression test covering polygon-only cutouts to prevent NaN transforms
body:
## Summary
- include pcb_cutout shapes when determining PCB SVG bounds so polygon cutouts contribute to the transform
- add a regression test covering polygon-only cutouts to prevent NaN transforms

## Testing
- BUN_UPDATE_SNAPSHOTS=1 bun test tests/pcb/pcb-cutout-polygon-bounds.test.ts
- bun test tests/pcb/pcb-cutout-polygon-bounds.test.ts
- bun test tests/pcb/pcb-cutout.test.ts
- bunx tsc --noEmit
- bun run format

------

title: Use includeBoardFiles to filter RunFrame board selector
description: Filters the RunFrame board selector using includeBoardFiles parsed from tscircuit.config.json and adds a fallback mechanism for invalid configurations.
body:
## Summary
- update @tscircuit/props and ensure micromatch is tracked as a dev dependency to support includeBoardFiles-driven filtering
- filter the RunFrame board selector using includeBoardFiles parsed from tscircuit.config.json
- add a shared helper that falls back to previous heuristics when the config is absent or invalid

## Testing
- bunx tsc --noEmit

title: refactor: centralize board file discovery, use `includeBoardFiles` from project config
description: Refactors the board file discovery process by centralizing it and utilizing the includeBoardFiles option from the project configuration, enhancing the build and snapshot commands to respect this configuration.
body:
## Summary
- upgrade @tscircuit/props to 0.0.364 and extend the project config schema with the new includeBoardFiles option
- reuse the configured board file globs when collecting files for tsci dev, tsci build, and tsci snapshot through a shared board file finder
- add coverage for the new config behavior and extend relevant CLI test timeouts to handle longer builds

## Testing
- bunx tsc --noEmit
- bun test tests/cli/build
- bun test tests/cli/snapshot

------
